selected_quotes: Machado et al.: 1-(7-Chloro-1,4-di­hydro­quinolin-4-yl­idene)thio­semicarbazide and its hy... #IUCr

citation.abstract: In the solid state, crystals of both 1-(7-chloro-1,4-dihydroquinolin-4-ylidene)thiosemicarbazide-methanol-water (2/1/1), 2C10H9ClN4S·CH3OH·H2O, (I), and its hydrochloride salt {systematic name: [(7-chloro-1,4-dihydroquinolin-4-ylidene)azaniumyl]thiourea chloride}, C10H10ClN4S(+)·Cl(-), (II), assume the imine tautomeric form, contrary to other 4-amino-7-chloroquinolines. Of particular interest are the N-C bond lengths, which have appreciable double-bond character, and the C-N-C aromatic ring bond angle. Both of these parameters have been studied extensively in 4-amino-substituted quinolines. The crystal structures of (I) and (II) in this study provide interesting examples of the amino-imino tautomerism which exists in this class of compound and is, to the best of our knowledge, hitherto unreported.
citation.journal: Acta Crystallographica Section C Structural Chemistry
citation.title: 1-(7-Chloro-1,4-di­hydro­quinolin-4-yl­idene)thio­semicarbazide and its hydro­chloride: evidence for the existence of a stable imine tautomer in the solid state of 4-amino­quinoline free bases, an anomalous case in nitro­gen heterocycles

author.name: Acta Cryst C
author.description: Acta Crystallographica Section C, published by the IUCr, is a  journal  for rapid dissemination of high-quality crystal and molecular structures
